name: Ernst Moritz Hahn
content: Ernst Moritz Hahn Ernst Moritz Hahn About me I am an assistant professor at the Formal Methods and Tools (FMT) group at the University of Twente within MariÃ«lle Stoelinga's project CAESAR. Google Scholar: http://scholar.google.de/citations?user=MH7fSVAAAAAJ ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9348-7684 DBLP: https://dblp.uni-trier.de/pid/78/6159.html Research Interests My main research interest is probabilistic model checking. This involves topics such as: Robustness analysis and improvement for deep neural networks stochastic hybrid systems efficient algorithms for deciding linear time logic properties continuous-time Markov chains with infinite state-space parametric and interval Markov models quantum Markov models reinforcement learning of linear-time properties multi-objective model checking stochastic parity games Contact University of Twente Room: Zilverling 3061 E-Mail: e.m.hahn@utwente.nl Lecturing Programme mentor of the Software Technology specialisation University of Twente since 2022 Master (Graduate association of the Carl von Ossietzky UniversitÃ¤t Oldenburg) 2015, 2023 Second reviewer of Bachelor thesis âPseuCo meets Java - Code Generation and Executionâ by Lisa Detzler Saarland University, 2014 Adviser of Bachelor thesis âProbabilistische Aspekte - AspectKP - ein verteiltes ProzesskalkÃ¼lâ by Christian Josef KÃ¶hl Saarland University, 2012 Adviser of Bachelor thesis âAnalyse Stochastischer Hybrider Systemeâ by Patrick Dubbert Saarland University, 2010 Coadviser of Master thesis âApproximation of Bisimulation in Probabilistic Metric Systemsâ by Fabian Bendun Saarland University, 2010 Coadviser of Master thesis âScheduler-Quantified Time-Bounded Reachability for Distributed Input/Output Interactive Probabilistic Chainsâ by Georgel Ionut Calin Saarland University, 2010 Advice concerning individual questions to individual Bachelor and Master students as well as student assistants, including Frits Dannenberg, Zhimin Wu, Yong Li, Fu Chen, Thomas Neele, Frits Dannenberg, Alexander Graf-Brill, Sascha Zickenrott, Ivan Pryvalov, Li Yi, Thomas Karos, Zhechao Lin, Yuliya Butkova and Dmytro Puzhay. Funding since 2021: Industrial PhD project in collaboration with Audi AG Ingolstadt funded by BMWi as part of the KARLI project (grant 19A21031C). This project about safety guarantees for DNN applications runs for 3 years. Audi pays the salary of the candidate as well as an annual fixed price of EUR 17,000 plus 15% IP surcharge (i.e. 19,550EUR per year). 2021: Established Memorandum of Understanding with Institute of Soft- ware, Chinese Academy of Sciences, to serve as framework for double-degree PhD student projects, to be financed (per PhD stu- dent) by the China Scholarship Council 11/2017 - 10/2018: Marie SkÅodowska Curie Individual Fellowship â PaVeCo - Parametrised Verification and Controlâ, Project ID 753351 (â¬195 455 total, âÂ£174 889) 12/2013 - 12/2016: PI of the project âModel Checking of Complex and Hybrid Stochastic Systemsâ, Grant No. 61350110518, 61450110461, 61550110506 of Research Fund for International Young Scientists (extended twice; RMB 200 000/year, âÂ£22 840, initially and after first extension; 	RMB 340 000/year, âÂ£38 828, after second extension) 6/2013 - 12/2016: Chinese Academy of Sciences fellowship for young international scientists, Grant No. 2013Y1GB0006 (extended twice; RMB 248 000/year, âÂ£28 321) 5/2008 â 4/2010: Stipend of the graduate school âLeistungsgarantien fÃ¼r Rechnersystemeâ, Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (DFG) Publications Last updated: 2023-01-18 2022 Meilun Li, Andrea Turrini, Ernst Moritz Hahn, Zhikun She, and Lijun Zhang.
